## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}

library(data.table)
df <- fread('~/DS202Labs/ds202_group4_final/MD_COVID-19_-_MASTER_Case_Tracker.csv')
show(df)
```

## Including Plots
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}


df1 <- df %>% dplyr::mutate(year = year(as.Date(df$ReportDate,format="%m/%d/%Y")),
                 month = lubridate::month(as.Date(df$ReportDate,format="%m/%d/%Y")),
                 day = lubridate::day(as.Date(df$ReportDate,format="%m/%d/%Y")))
```


You can also embed plots, for example:
```{r}
ggplot(data=df1, aes(x=df1$month, y=df1$TotalCases)) +
  facet_grid(. ~df1$year)+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()
```
```{r}
ggplot(data=df1, aes(x=df1$month, y=df$PosTestPercent)) +
  facet_grid(. ~df1$year)+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data=df1, aes(x=df1$total_hospitalized, y=df1$bedsTotal)) +
  geom_point()
```
```{r}
proportion = df1$total_released / df1$total_hospitalized

ggplot(data=df1, aes(df1$month)) +
  geom_point(aes(y=df1$total_released, color = "green")) +
  geom_point(aes(y=df1$TotalCases, color = "red"))

```


Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
